name: remortgaged
content:
Add to word list

past simple and past participle of
remortgage
to change the conditions of a mortgage (= agreement by which you borrow money to buy property), usually by increasing the amount you borrow: Many borrowers remortgage every three or five years to take advantage of cheap fixed rates. Robin decided to remortgage his house to pay off his debts.
More examplesFewer examplesHe advised me to remortgage with a lender with a lower standard rate.She remortgaged her £123,000 one-bed flat over the summer and had it valued at £126,000. It is never a good idea to remortgage your house to pay off other creditors.
